question: In which of the following forests of India, worldâ€™s first tiger census was carried out in 1932 ?
explanation: In the year 1932, the world's first tiger census was carried out in the forests of Palamu. The Palamu Tiger Reserve is situated in the state of Jharkhand. It has a total area of 1,129.93 sq km. The tiger reserve was set up in 1973.
